definition: variant of 蹴[cu4]
carefully/to kick/to tread on/to stamp

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning
to get there in one step (idiom); easily done/success at a stroke/to get results overnight
to get there in one step (idiom); easily done/success at a stroke/to get results overnight
to succeed at the first try (idiom)/easy as pie/one can do it at once
to get there in one step (idiom); easily done/success at a stroke/to get results overnight
variant of 蹴鞠[cu4 ju1]
cuju, ancient Chinese football (soccer)

sentences.english: Then you can fix photos in a snap with one-click quick fixes.
sentences.chinese: 然后您可以修复的照片，轻松一按一蹴。

sentences.english: Golden Xiuyi jacket , Sachet Ribbon, both pairs of instant success.
sentences.chinese: 金绣衣襦，香囊结带，双双对蹴。

definition: to get there in one step (idiom); easily done/success at a stroke/to get results overnight
to stumble/to trample/to kick (of horse)

lit. one morning and one evening (idiom)/fig. in a short period of time/overnight
lit. to want sth in haste, but cannot get there (idiom, from Analects); more haste, less speed/don't try to run before you can walk
anxious for quick results (idiom); to demand instant success/impatient for result/impetuous
lit. to want to get fat with only one mouthful (proverb)/fig. to try to achieve one's goal in the shortest time possible/to be impatient for success
pinyin: yi1 kou3 chi1 ge5 pang4 zi5

definition: effort will undoubtedly lead to success (idiom)
to give up halfway (idiom); leave sth unfinished
step by step/at every step
bit by bit/every little bit
lit. piling up dirt eventually creates a mountain (idiom)/fig. success is the cumulation of lots of small actions
lit. where water flows, a canal is formed (idiom)/fig. when conditions are right, success will follow naturally
towering buildings are built up from the ground (idiom)/great oaks from little acorns grow
pinyin: wan4 zhang4 gao1 lou2 ping2 di4 qi3

definition: dripping water penetrates the stone (idiom); constant perseverance yields success/You can achieve your aim if you try hard without giving up./Persistent effort overcomes any difficulty.
one day's sun, ten days' frost (idiom, from Mencius); fig. to work for a bit then skimp/sporadic effort/lack of sticking power/short attention span
pavilion in the air (idiom); unrealistic Utopian construction/castles in Spain/imaginary future plans
